intro: Polygala capitolensis, commonly known as the Capitolia milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which is known for its diverse and often ornamental species. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
